ETYMOLOGY: From Latin ambiguus ('doubtful, wavering'), derived from ambigere ('to wander, doubt'), from ambi- ('around') + agere ('to drive, lead').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Open to more than one interpretation; not expressed or understood clearly.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 模棱两可的；含糊不清的；有多种解释的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The phrasing of the contract was deliberately ambiguous to allow for future flexibility.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 合同的措辞被故意写得含糊不清，以便将来能有灵活性。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Difficult to classify, categorize, or resolve; having an uncertain nature or outcome.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 难以归类的；不确定的（指局面、性质或结果）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The moral standing of the anti-hero remained ambiguous throughout the film.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位反面英雄的道德立场在整部电影中一直是不确定的。
